unserious adjective
(NOT IMPORTANT)
Add to word list

unserious adjective
(NOT DETERMINED)
not intending to achieve something or not working hard to achieve something: unserious about The government's refusal to restructure the rail industry showed how unserious it was about transport. He was unserious in college, in spite of having a first-class intellect.
More examplesFewer examplesHe says that the major networks are fundamentally unserious about doing any in-depth analysis of current affairs.The aim was to stop unserious owners from pretending to sell their home just to see what their property was worth.
